sentences.sContent: Can you say that again? I didn’t hear.
sentences.sCn: 你能再说一遍吗？ 我没听见。

sentences.sContent: Mr Khan’s busy. Can you try again later?
sentences.sCn: 卡恩先生正忙着。 你能不能过一会儿再打来？

sentences.sContent: In 1997, the family moved house yet again.
And again, these workshops will benefit the community widely.
sentences.sCn: 再说，这些工作坊会令社区很多人受惠。

sentences.sContent: ...and the fantasy proneness means that they revisit those memories again and again in the coming weeks and months...
...Thank you again for staying at Sheraton Hotel...
...then I start again at5:30 and work until 11，six days a week...
...Time and again I've seen examples of this kind of program working...
...Mclaughlin once again demonstrated his carelessness by knocking down several mail boxes near the edge of the company’s parking lot...
...we look forward to seeing you again the next time your computer crashes...
...So it’s only when the economy is healthy again that we’ll begin to see just how many broken families have been created...
...The divorce rate rose again during the rest of the decade as the recovery took hold...
...then I start again at 5:30 and work until 11...

phrases.pCn: adv. 一再地；反复不断地
拒绝再玩，不再；再也不会
一次又一次；多次，不断地

trans.tranOther: one more time – used when something has happened or been done before
